title: Brave New World
author: aldous-huxley
summary: Set in a futuristic World State of genetically modified citizens, the novel explores a society governed by pleasure, consumption, and conformity. Regularly ranked among the greatest English-language novels of the 20th century.

attribution.note: Book data from Open Library (openlibrary.org), part of Internet Archive.

description: Originally published in 1932, this outstanding work of literature is more crucial and relevant today than ever before. Cloning, feel-good drugs, antiaging programs, and total social control through politics, programming, and media -- has Aldous Huxley accurately predicted our future? With a storyteller's genius, he weaves these ethical controversies in a compelling narrative that dawns in the year 632 AF (After Ford, the deity).
